title: Research-Based Multimedia Instructional Design: Optimizing Learning in Social Studies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and smartphone utilization skills
context.additional_context: Research-based multimedia design strategies are needed to effectively deliver social studies content in resource-constrained technology environments where smartphones are the primary medium. Learners are interested in professional career paths but have beginner-level domain expertise.

learning_goals: Learners can explain core concepts of social studies with 85% or higher accuracy through content designed according to multimedia principles (integration of audio and visual materials)

Learners can propose three or more application plans for social issues in real-world professional contexts (medical/legal/technical) using interactive multimedia activities (timeline charts, virtual case simulations) within an LMS
Learners self-diagnose multimedia learning effectiveness and develop improvement plans through formative assessment quizzes (image-text matching, video analysis).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
